body_html: I noticed the problem while I was using the built-in DataLoader class, which uses pytorch's internal multiprocessing. I just used pythons multiprocessing in the example to demonstrate that the whole program will become locked to one CPU core when pytorch is imported. I also tried explicitly changing "from multiprocessing import Process" to "from torch.multiprocessing import Process" and exactly the same thing happens.

body: I noticed the problem while I was using the built-in DataLoader class, which uses pytorch's internal multiprocessing. I just used pythons multiprocessing in the example to demonstrate that the whole program will become locked to one CPU core when pytorch is imported. I also tried explicitly changing "from multiprocessing import Process" to "from torch.multiprocessing import Process" and exactly the same thing happens.
